Really nice speed after 12 hours

1st of all Thankyou for sharing this game.I wanted to write acomment of how it plays.How can find the words to say how just plain bad the graphics And handling are? As i limp around the tracks rendered in glorious flintstones level quality in my ford focus,i am laughing at what the heck happened to the awesome quality vids i had seen previewing the game--how on earth did i end up with flinstones level graphics realism that looked like it was from a game 5 or more yrs old?grid absolutely slaughters this game as does dirt 2 and most shockingly  even the original shift game far surpases this one, they managed to make it Worse on all levels!NFS hot pursuit is Way more fun, better handling and superior in graphics both on cars and landscapes. im running it on a quadcore intel with 6 gigs ram and an 8800gt. all settings maxed,  at 1680x1050 with decent frame rates..maybe it will look better and be more fun with the hypercars unlocked and other tracks, but my 1st impressions were like :youve GOT to be Kidding me!:it just cant be This bad,im in driving hell...it didnt hold my interest for more than 20 mins.. feedback from others would be interesting

@ChiliBeef
nope nothing wrong after i press cancel nothing happens and many people are having the same problem with THIS version
@chip211 = Well, don't know what to tell you.  I used this version and the crack from AiTB as well and everything worked flawlessly.

Good visuals, soundtrack (or lack of) isn't the pile of shit that was the previous. So that's great but... the gameplay handling is still the most absolute piece of shit to drive/play with a keyboard. I really think they have some contract with wheel manufacturors to get some slice of the profit because the game even with the assists turned on is an unbelievable uncontrollable mess! Oversteering like hell, even when ur with the same class/car of the AI ahead of you at the same speed and same path line the car will just fking drift and skid on the slightest turn. Not worth the money sadly, better of with the older Race driver grid.

@ doobtribe:
I've never had much luck using a keyboard to drive.  But, even with a Logitech gamepad controller, the handling of the cars does feel atrocious.  They handle like weighted bricks and I don't recall Shift 1 having this kind of trouble.  I also wondered if this was their way of getting people to purchase steering wheel/pedal sets. *LOL*

Shift 2 Unleashed Minimum System Requirements:

Required - Internet Connection
OS - Windows XP (SP3) / Vista (SP2)/ Windows 7
Processor - Intel CoreTM2 Duo 2.0 GHz / AMD X2 64 2.4GHz
Memory - 2.0 GB
Hard Drive - 7 GB
DVD Drive - 8x SPEED
Video Card - DirectX 9.0c Compatible 3D-accelerated 512 MB video card with Shader Model 3.0 or higher
Sound Card - DirectX 9.0c compatible
DirectX - Version 9.0c
Online Multiplayer - 512 Kbps or faster; 2-12 Players
Input - Keyboard, Mouse, Supported Game Controllers
Optional - USB Steering Wheel / Dual Analogue Gamepad

*Supported chipsets: ATI HD3 Series or greater; NVIDIA GeForce 8 Series or higher or greater

Laptop versions of these chipsets may work but are not supported. Updates to your video and sound card drivers may be required.

EA Download Manager Users require 8.16 GB additional space for temporary installation files

*NOTE - To install the game properly on Windows XP/Windows Vista/7, you will need administrator access to your machine
